name: Orbits: The Sandbox
description:
Orbits: The Sandbox is an N-Body space simulation for all ages,  as well as a unique gravitational art creator. The game is created with the aim of peaking interest and curiosity in space and physics in children and adults alike. It employs a friendly, approachable low-poly art style and intuitive controls to create a space in which inquisitive minds can carry out experiments on a celestial scale. Orbits: The Sandbox allows the user absolute power over our solar system, with which they can move, create and manipulate celestial objects then sit back and watch the resulting pandemonium unfold.

Controls

  • Press F12 to take a screenshot of your artistic creation.
  • Click on an object to focus on it, then zoom in and out with W and S/ Up and Down or the Scroll Wheel.
  • Press the Left and Right Arrow keys to cycle between objects in the scene.
  • To create an object, select a category and click on it's picture in the left-hand panel then click into the scene.
  • Press Delete on your keyboard to delete the selected object, such as the sun, for very interesting results.
  • Click on the 'Record that!' button in the bottom right, or press F2, to save the last few seconds as a GIF.
  • Press F1 to toggle the visibility of the UI, to see space in all its glory.
  • Press Esc to Open the pause menu and from there exit the game.

Bugs

This  project is currently in it's Alpha state, and so expect a few issues. If you find any bugs, please let me know by commenting in the relevant thread on the forums and I will fix them as soon as I am able. Likewise for any suggestions.

Feedback Wanted!

Developing games is fun, but takes a lot of work. Hearing that people have had fun playing something I've made makes it all worth it a thousand times over. Whether you've enjoyed yourself or not, I'd love to hear your thoughts, feedback and suggestions on the game via the forums below!
